title: Disney Parks Basics
description: Test your knowledge of the Happiest Places on Earth!

questions.question: When did Disneyland in California open?
questions.explanation: Disneyland opened on July 17, 1955, in Anaheim, California, making it the first Disney theme park.

questions.question: Walt Disney was alive when Walt Disney World opened.
questions.explanation: Walt Disney died in 1966, and Walt Disney World didn't open until October 1, 1971.

questions.question: How many Disney theme park resorts are there worldwide?
questions.explanation: There are 6 Disney resorts: Disneyland, Walt Disney World, Tokyo Disney, Disneyland Paris, Hong Kong Disneyland, and Shanghai Disneyland.

questions.question: What is the iconic castle at Magic Kingdom called?
questions.explanation: Cinderella Castle is the icon of Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World, standing 189 feet tall.

questions.question: What are Disney theme park employees called?
questions.explanation: Disney refers to all employees as Cast Members because they're part of the show for guests.

questions.question: Main Street, U.S.A. is designed to look like Walt Disney's hometown.
questions.explanation: Main Street, U.S.A. is inspired by Walt Disney's childhood hometown of Marceline, Missouri.

questions.question: What is the term for the hidden Mickey Mouse shapes throughout the parks?
questions.explanation: Hidden Mickeys are subtle Mickey Mouse shapes hidden throughout Disney parks and resorts by Imagineers.

questions.question: What company designs Disney attractions?
questions.explanation: Walt Disney Imagineering (WDI) is the design and development arm that creates Disney attractions.
